attributes.action: Local councils  to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.background: The consumption of clean water is a basic human need and millions of plastic bottles end up in landfills or in oceans to be eaten by marine life then into the food chain and human beings. Ask Parliament to implement a legal duty for local councils to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence for the danger of the breakdown of plastic is overwhelming, 
both in terms of damage to the environment, the food chain and in human bodies. This is an unknown health hazard and any efforts to reduce the use of plastic will be beneficial.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-43388870 
http://www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org/ 
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plastic_pollution 
https://www.lifewithoutplastic.com 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-42264788 
http://www.sciencemag.org/tags/plastic-pollution 
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-018-03104-3 
https://plasticoceans.org/the-facts/ 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/jan/25/new-network-of-water-refill-points-aims-to-reduce-englands-plastic-waste

attributes.action: Pledge 5% of the UK's annual GDP to halt climate change
attributes.background: By heavily investing in green technologies, research and infrastructure within the UK now, this government would assure the industrial sector for the UK would become the preeminent leader in all green technologies before the rest of the world inevitably takes similar measures.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45084144

attributes.action: Make teaching coping mechanisms compulsory in secondary schools
attributes.background: At 8 years-old I lost my mum to cancer, and I'd never dealt with it until 20 years later, because I wasn't equipped with adequate coping mechanisms. Children everywhere are unequipped to deal with trauma they experience on a daily basis, and the stress of later life, I'd like to change that.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 British people suffer from mental health problems, and depression is 10x more widespread than it was just a decade ago (demonstrating its alarming growth under societal changes). 85% of adults experience stress on a regular basis; a cause of anxiety, depression, panic attacks and insomnia. Suicide is the biggest cause of death in men betweeh 20 - 49. And LGBT people are more likely to experience mental health problems, and less likely to have support systems.

attributes.action: Stop the ageist segregation in minimum wage. Living costs are all the same.
attributes.background: Their are four segratory categories to minimum wage. 16-17, 18-20, 21-24 and over 25. The hourly minimum difference between what a 16 year old can earn to a 25 year old is £3.63. If they were working a full time week consisting of 40 hours thats an overall anual difference of £6,969.60.
attributes.additional_details: For a 16 and 25 year old working full time, doing the same job on minimum wage their annual differential income is £6,969.60. The guardian quotes: “A single person living in Britain needs to earn at least £13,400 a year before tax to afford a basic but acceptable standard of living” however for a sixteen year old on minimum wage working 40 hours per week will earn an average anual salary of £8,064. That’s only 60.17% of what is recommended for a stable income and living.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys in children’s fast food meals.
attributes.background: Fast food restaurants produce billions of non essential plastic toys every year to give away in children’s meals. The toys which are packed in plastic bags are usually thrown away before the children even leave the restaurant.
attributes.additional_details:
Children seem to enjoy the toys more than the meals but fast food outlets could change this by offering more variety and healthier choices. They could perhaps create paper comics as an alternative to the toys and these could be recycled. 
There is too much waste in the world and too much plastic going to landfill and ending up in our oceans. Fast food outlets would make a massive difference if they cared more about the plastic waste that they produce.

attributes.action: The importance of Attachment, should be taught in antenatal classes.
attributes.background: John Bowlby started his research in the 1960's - importance of a primary bond to a main person. He discovered that this role was vital in for survival, not only through infancy but long into adulthood. I struggle to understand in the 2018, this information is still not taught in antenatal classes.
attributes.additional_details: Attachments styles forms the basis of all children's relationships. The bonds that are created in the child's early life, impact the way a child develops all the way through their life. A secure attachment can create a child who is self-confident, self-resilient and has the support network to overcome barriers. An insecure attachment can affect a child in the opposite way. A child may become insecure, limited self-regulation and may struggle to form and maintain relation/friendships.

attributes.action: Make food and drink labelling more specific when stating may contain nuts
attributes.background: So many packaging contains the phrase “may contain nuts”. This needs to be more specific as someone with a peanut allergy may not have an allergy to any other nuts but won’t buy the product because it’s not specific enough even though this particular nut may not be present.
attributes.additional_details: most manufacturers use the term “may contain nuts” for example brands such as Cadbury, Kellogg’s, Peters pies the list goes on. The labelling has been seen on yoghurt, cereals, baked goods and even bread. People with a certain nut allergy should be able to look at the packaging and see what nuts could be present so that they’re not excluded from all nuts that they are able to consume

attributes.action: Stop sending our Foreign aid money to countries with no animal rights
attributes.background: We give huge sums of our taxes to countries like China, Vietnam, Pakistan etc where animals both domestic and farmed are given no protection whatsoever from abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Countless petitions to these Governments pleading to stop atrocities like Yulin Dog Eating 'Festival' or Vietnamese slaughtering cattle with a sledgehammer seem to fall on deaf ears. I propose we stop our taxes being donated as foreign aid to these countries and I believe that 'money talks' so perhaps they will listen!
Sign and share please, let's see where this goes!

attributes.action: Halt arms sales to Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has carried out indiscriminate airstrikes in Yemen which have resulted in thousands of civilian deaths.
attributes.additional_details: These have been allowed by the British government's licensing of £4.6bn of arms sales to the kingdom since the start of the Yemeni Civil War in 2015. Saudi Arabia's blockade of Yemen has also resulted in the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on HS2. Give the public the vote like we had for Brexit.
attributes.background: HS2 is expected to cost £50+billion, not to mention the mess and impact it will make on our countryside, wildlife and nature. At present our NHS, emergency services, social services, affordable housing is in disarray. We were given a referendum on Brexit which will affect us all so why not HS2?
attributes.additional_details: Having undertaken a great deal of research into the pro's & con's of this project, attended HS2 facilitated meetings, researched the impact nationally that this will bring I can't help but feel that even though Royal assent has been given its not to late to allow the public to vote on whether this project should go ahead. This country already has a good railway system which with investment can be improved using existing lines. The HS2 project is a national issue so should be decided by us all.

attributes.action: Legalise the permanent removal of front number plates.
attributes.background: As an avid car modifier and petrolhead, I and most people know find that the front number plates on our vehicles can really stand out more than we want and slightly ruin the look and aesthetic of the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details: The ability to permanently remove the front number plate could also reduce the risk of number plate theft by criminals as there are less possibilities. People say that it gives more opportunities for crime to be committed using the car but if the police never chase from the front so their DVLA scanners would still be able to correctly operate. The issue of speed cameras could be resolved by simply making them double sided so that they can capture criminals from both sides of the road.

attributes.action: Create a Dedicated Minister for Dogs (and cats)
attributes.background:
49% of UK adults own a pet. 25% of the UK adult have a cat with an estimated population of 11.1 million pet cats. 24% of the UK adult population have a dog with an estimated population of 8.9 million pet dogs.
The cost of keeping a dog each year varies by breed size £750 - £5,000
attributes.additional_details: Many services for the dog industry are not officially regulated or regulated enough. The laws are outdated, and have no consequences, yet many dogs suffer, and owners have no support if their dogs are harmed or stolen. There are various bodies and charities but each stands alone. Sweden has many forward thinking ideas which could be followed. Pet owners are often frustrated by having no voice!

attributes.action: Cyclists - Make it mandatory for bicycles to have registration license plates
attributes.background: After years driving on UK roads, it is a very widely known fact that it is very difficult for cyclists to be held accountable for their traffic offences, such as running through red traffic lights and riding recklessly on pavements putting pedestrians at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/08/40-cyclists-jump-red-light-in-30-seconds--video/ 
https://www.ft.com/content/d430ddc2-4936-11e8-8ae9-4b5ddcca99b3

attributes.action: Scrap the charges for child arrangement applications
attributes.background:
Where a resident parent agitates or denies contact between non resident parents and their children, the process for an arrangement order demands the non resident parent pay costs of £215 after also having to pay for attempts at mediation.
The right to a family life should not be priced in this way.

attributes.action: Include black role models as part of history education throughout the year.
attributes.background: Black history is not a compulsory part of UK education – we are asking the government to look at the positive impact of including important black role models as part of history education throughout the academic year.

attributes.action: Prevent payment of EU ‘exit fee’ until a beneficial trade deal has been ratified
attributes.background:
The Government has offered to pay up to £39bn to the EU as an exit fee despite there being no legal requirement to do so.
Put it into law that not a penny should be paid until a final trade deal with demonstrable benefits to the UK economy has been signed and ratified by all EU member states.

attributes.action: Increase Defence spending to at least 2.5% of GDP per year
attributes.background: If the U.K. wants to maintain its global influence, it must increase its defence budget, rather than continue to cut it.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of support given to sexual assault and rape victims.
attributes.background: 85000 women and 12000 men are raped every year, that is 11 every hour. 13% of women who are raped attempt suicide and 94% experience post- traumatic stress disorder within two weeks of the incident. I believe that all victims should be provided with support to guide them to living with the trauma.
attributes.additional_details: Misconceptions about false reporting have direct, negative consequences and may contribute to why many victims do not report it. I believe people should be better educated about the issues and people need to know about what they can do to help. Rapes do not always occur between strangers in dark alleys, 85 to 90 percent of victims know their attacker; this only makes it harder for victims to move on from the incident.

attributes.action: Lower the age for smear tests.
attributes.background:
The legal age to be provided a smear test is 25, why is this? Because it seems to be that it is ‘rare’ for women to be diagnosed with cervical cancer under the age of 25, but it happens. 
This is why I want to lower the age to at least 16, seeing as this is the LEGAL age to have sex.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 3,126 cases of cervical cancer in 2015. How many of these women were over 25? We don’t know. 
There were 854 deaths caused by cervical cancer in 2016 alone.
99.8% of cases could of be prevented in 2016, is this because some of the women were under 25 and weren’t provided a smear test?
Being 19 and having issues and worries about my health is scary, to not be provided a smear test for me is upsetting and worrying. Please help me lower the age to 16 at the very least. Help save lives.

attributes.action: British students to receive U.K student loan when studying a whole degree abroad
attributes.background: I have personally been offered an incredible opportunity to study at the prestigious Design Academy Eindhoven, however I have no access to the English student loan system. So although I will be representing England as an international student I can not receive any financial support.
attributes.additional_details: Although the cost of studying internationally is lower with no access to any finance loans how can one be expected to pay outright their tuition fees and all living expenses without a loan. If British students were able to experience university in another country they would be able to bring their cultural knowledge and developed skills back to England to then pay back the student loan they borrowed from the English Government whilst in employment in the country.

attributes.action: Officially publicise only one title of Ms. for married and unmarried women.
attributes.background: Women must reveal their marital status on their title. This makes an issue for widows and some women who were discriminated by their title. The UK government must stop offering Mrs. & Miss as options and remove titles of Mrs. & Miss on all documents that they are responsible for.
attributes.additional_details: The title Ms. began to be used as early as the 17th century, as a title which like Mister that did not originally indicate marital status. It fell into disuse until the 20th century. What is needed today is a more comprehensive term which does homage to the sex without expressing any views as to their domestic situation. Ask the government to remove Mrs. & Miss. from official documentation, recognise and publicise Ms. functions officially as the only title both for married and unmarried women.

attributes.action: Introduce a reassuring EM radiation limit for homes and schools (eg 1,000 µW/m2)
attributes.background:
There is no specific limit for mobile phone radiation in homes. We use the out-dated 1998 ICNIRP recommendation for incidental public exposure, which includes no risk management. 

Badly sited masts result in unnecessarily high levels which are never turned off and the health impact is unknown.
attributes.additional_details:
The World Health Organisation continues to rate this type of radiation as a Class 2b Carcinogen and many studies link it to childhood lukemia and other illnesses. Sufferers of electrosensitivity are also becoming increasingly common.

A phone network continues to work at 0.000002µW/m2 (source: powerwatch.org.uk). Before it stopped auditing it, over 10 years ago, the highest level Ofcom recorded inside a residence was 790µW/m2. Other countries have sensible limits without affecting reception.

attributes.action: Impose time limits for developers upon beginning and finishing construction.
attributes.background: The law should be changed so that Local Planning Authorities must revoke Planning Permission after 18 months if work has not begun. They should also be able to impose financial penalties upon developers who fail to begin construction within 18 months and time limits for completion of projects.
attributes.additional_details: All Local Authorities have a statutory obligation to ensure that they have a 5 year supply of new homes. The efforts of Local Authorities trying to meet their quota is being hampered by developers who do not begin construction once permission is granted. The five year supply is measured by newly completed or dwellings under construction. At present developers are at liberty to submit planning applications on any site if the Local Authority does not have an approved five year housing supply

attributes.action: To make it compulsory that new drivers take a speed awareness course
attributes.background: On 22nd May 2018 my brother-in-law tragically died after road traffic accident. Ryan was on life support for 3 days when the doctors told his parents there was nothing else they could do for Ryan, the damage to his brain was so severe. This all happened because of speeding and lack of knowledge.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to make it compulsory that everyone after passing their practical driving test must take a speed awareness course before being allowed to drive legally on their own.

attributes.action: Make an unlawful killing law for killing pets.
attributes.background: Our 'family pet' was killed without justifiable cause. We have received unsatisfactory help from the 'authorities'. I feel a change in the law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Recently our family pet (dog) was killed by another dog owner who was 'trying to separate' six excited, playing dogs (3 of them his own) with a small branch/large stick laying nearby. He killed our dog Louie with one hit on the head. The R.S.P.C.A. say it wasn't cruelty as Louie died instantly and the police are not pursuing a prosecution. This has caused a lot of distress to the family and a lot of concern locally. A new law or a clearer defining of current laws are urgently needed.

attributes.action: Urge Uganda to give MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades a fair trial.
attributes.background: Ugandan MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi aka Bobi Wine and his comrades were arrested and allegedly brutally tortured whilst supporting campaigns for an aspiring opposition MP in the northern part of Uganda. We believe this incident is in breach of commonwealth democratic values.
attributes.additional_details: We fear that he has been arrested on false charges, simply for being a successful opposition politician and we are worried he will not be given a fair trial. The UK Government should do all it can to help ensure that Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades are given a fair trial.

attributes.action: Allow a long term partner to be named on the death certificate
attributes.background: My partner and I have been living together for 15 years. We have been together through homelessness, the loss of a child and finally his death. We couldn’t afford to get divorced from our previous partners and so we never married. On registering his death his wife’s name was used not mine

attributes.action: Change the laws on buying and selling property in England and Wales
attributes.background: The government urgently need to review the laws relating to buying and selling property.Buying or selling a property is one of the most stressful experiences of any adults life.
attributes.additional_details: The current system is open to absolute abuse and gives neither the buyer or seller any security or confidence that the transaction will be completed.Should one part of the housing chain collapse, many individuals and families are caused massive distress,anxiety and financial loss.It isn't difficult to change the laws to those they follow in Scotland.This is the 21st century.The laws need to be changed now.As far as I can see the only reason changes haven't been made is because the lawyers don't want it changed.If the property sale falls through, they still get paid.

attributes.action: Stop the slaughtering of farmed animals for human consumption.
attributes.background: Animals are forcibly impregnated, kept in closed and confined spaces, stunned (although in some cases like Halal slaughterhouses they are not stunned) and slaughtered.
attributes.additional_details:
As the superior species, we should help and protect animals now that we have adapted to create alternatives, like burgers out of plant foods!
 
Relevant documentaries:
Cowspiracy Documentary:  https://www.netflix.com/title/80033772 
What the Health: https://www.netflix.com/title/80174177?s=i”

attributes.action: Allow carers who have SGO/parental responsibility paid time off work
attributes.background: We are currently fostering a baby under kinship care however looking at applying for special guardianship and need to be able to give him the time he deserves without being penalised financially
attributes.additional_details: You get paid leave from work if you give birth to a child or adopt a child.  If you gain parental responsibly any other way eg SGO which comes under the adoption act there is no paid time to bond, get them settled in thier forever home and for the new parents.  These children and parents have the same rights responsibilities and needs of any parent/child often more so depending on the child's background.  I believe there should be leave similar to adoption leave allowed in these circumstances.

attributes.action: Make it law for all property floors to be soundproofed if above another property
attributes.background: Property in the UK, especially in London can be very close to one another. If you live beneath someone in a flat and they haven’t got efficient soundproofing it can be a nuisance even though the people above aren’t doing anything wrong.
attributes.additional_details: I lived in a property for three years where the noises from above became a constant nuisance. All they were doing was walking but it was an awful noise, especially at night when they would be awake at 1am. My anger was not directed at my neighbours but at the law not looking after people living beneath other people.

attributes.action: Provide funding for mental health facilities in schools.
attributes.background:
As a young person, I feel it is my duty to break the stigma of mental health. If we can manage this problem right from the root, we can decrease suicide rates and prevent mental illnesses from progressing.
Statistics shows that mental health issues in young people have increased 6X since 1995.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been a significant increase in recent years and young people aren't reporting issues such as anxiety or depression. 

We need trained staff and support in schools; there are so many young people that need support but do not know how to speak out. Without services providing adequate support for all young people, there is absolutely no way we will be able to climb out this dark hole we currently find ourselves in.

attributes.action: Make changes to make the theft of a dog a specific offence.
attributes.background: Dog theft is on the increase. A dog is not an object like the law considers them at the moment, the same as the treatment is different to how you would treat an object. The law needs to change in order to curb the increase in dog theft and the misery it brings to many.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics suggest that 60 dogs are stolen every week. That's 60 to many.

attributes.action: Only allow uni students to vote in their home town, not where they are studying.
attributes.background: Currently, university students can either vote in their uni town or home town and many choose the former. The huge density of students in certain areas now mean that students control the vote and their issues can dominate the political agenda and effectively disenfranchise the local community.
attributes.additional_details: This is not driven by anti-student sentiment but more through a sense of democracy. For example, if there was a General Election in their first week at uni, the student could vote in the uni town without any knowledge of local issues or the local MP. They will probably spend 27 months over 3 years at uni and yet a parliamentary term is 60 months, so their vote affects the area long after they've left! They can also vote in local elections, on local issues from Day 1.

attributes.action: Funding for Harness Racing in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: The sport of harness racing deserves government recognition as an official sport in the United kingdon. If the rest of the world has the support and funding from the government's tben why don't we? We need the support of the government to keep our sport alive!!
attributes.additional_details:
www.bhrc.org.uk

We are a not for profit organisation  and need your support!

attributes.action: The environment to be taught as a compulsory subject throughout school life.
attributes.background: All the good we do now with regards to litter picking, recycling, and on environmental issues will be a complete waste of time if we do not start to educate everyone from the year dot. We need to stop the rot so that our future generations will make a better job of looking after our world.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the people reading this will never have known what it is like to be brought up in a clean and pristine country. If we want to change this for our future generations we have to start NOW, and as with everything in life it begins with education. Many children are shown and taught to do the right thing before they start school, sadly many more are not because their parents themselves were not taught. We urgently need to stop this repetitive cycle which is why l have started this petition.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic tampon applicators
attributes.background: Like straws, applicator tampons are used once and then thrown away. A lot end up in the oceans harming wildlife and tainting the oceans. Others end up in landfill where they will take 100s of years to break down. There are other types of products available.

attributes.action: Free dental care for UK University Students whilst in full-time education
attributes.background: UK University students over the age of 19 currently have to pay for dental care. This is very expensive and students already have the burden of paying for rent, food, college material and travel. Paying an excessive amount for dental care is off-putting and deprives some from getting essential care.

attributes.action: Raise the max speed limit on motorways to 110 mph.
attributes.background: Due to the increasing tech of today's cars it becoming more and more unsafe to have an enforced 70 mph speed limit on UK motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
70 mph speed limits were introduced in 1965 when car wheels looked more like today's bicycle wheels. Technology has moved on unbelievable amounts in the subsequent over half a century, and is tried tested and proven to be safe at speeds exceeding 70 mph.
The mixture of the 70 mph speed limit and today's tech and ease of speed in cars erodes away at our famous British ability to maintain safe lane discipline on our motorways.

attributes.action: Legislate so that for each creation of life peers, males do not exceed females
attributes.background: A Parliament that reflects the diversity of the population would be better able to represent the people. Every government since the 1950s has appointed twice as many male life peers than female. This needs to be addressed.
attributes.additional_details:
The proportion of women in the House of Lords (26%) is lower than in every other parliament and assembly in the UK. 
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/LLN-2018-0015

Legislation exists to seat female bishops as Lords Spiritual preferentially, to address historic gender discrimination. 
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/LLN-2017-0056

attributes.action: Stop convicted criminals being able to change name by Deed poll.
attributes.background: This is very important. Just recently a child killer who served only 3 yrs changed his name by deed poll to hide his criminal past. No background checks are made when applying to change name by deed poll, why?
attributes.additional_details: Background checks on passports, entering Government buildings and new jobs, but we have no background checks on people wanting to change name legally, it can be done within and hour online.

attributes.action: Ensure British food standards are met in any free trade agreement with USA
attributes.background: Once 'Brexit' is complete the government will be able to seek its own Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) with other countries, most notably the USA. The USA use hormones in the rearing of their meat, Genetically Modified vegetables, and have low animal welfare requirements.
attributes.additional_details: We want all food in Britain to adhere to our standards. We do not want chicken that has been washed in chlorine, we do not want beef which has been injected with hormones, we do not want pigs who have suffered horrendous conditions to be allowed to arrive in the UK. Raising and management of animal products in this way goes against the values that the British public hold. We hold our government accountable for protecting these values.

attributes.action: Give an income tax break for carers and nurses to promote work in healthcare
attributes.background: Raising minimum wage has not been as helpful as hoped, the problem is that when it’s raised so is the competition at local supermarkets etc. Some care homes can not afford to raise further. Giving a tax benefit to carers and nurses would encourage and reward people who work in this industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of local authorities pay rates to care homes that means they struggle to break even, some have to reduce staffing numbers to compensate putting people at extreme risk. Other operators that also support people who pay privately are able to work more effectively but still have to pay the minimum wage.

We could make it policy that all carers and nurses that work under a cqc registration for care would benefit. This would have an added impact by encouraging people to leave temp agencies

attributes.action: To increase funding to Citizens Advice
attributes.background: With the growing demand on Citizens Advice and closure of other organisations. This means bigger work loads with reduced funding. To provide a more comprehensive service Citizens Advice need more funding

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Animal to be recognised as an Assistance Dog.
attributes.background: In America service dogs cover both physical and mental health needs. Anxiety is a mental health condition that can cripple the people who suffer from it many of whom struggle to go outside let alone have a life that is equal to non-sufferers. Same goes for depression. So why can they not have help.
attributes.additional_details: The definition given by the government website for disability is to have a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial/long-term negative effect on ability to do normal daily activities. Anxiety, depression and other mental health illnesses fall under this and yet service dogs are not allowed. Dogs are important for people with mental health and allowing them to go everywhere with the person, like a guide dog, such as shops and restaurants allows the person to become a more active member of society.

attributes.action: Amnesty for T4 students who overstayed because of colleges closed by UK in 2014.
attributes.background: In 2014 to achieve the unrealistic target of net migration figure, the UKBA closed a large number of colleges and played with students’ future. They lost their tuition fees and many of them didn’t find a way to came out from this problem.
attributes.additional_details: Young people especially the students are the backbone of every economy in the world. Most of the overstayed students are good at English and are working part-time as well, to support themselves and the UK economy by paying taxes. They are just the victims of unrealistic Home Office targets. Many of them are now working in low paid jobs and the businesses are just abusing and exploiting them. Giving them amnesty will bring them into the taxpayer net, and yield millions of pounds in tax and national insurance and they will contribute to the UK economy.

attributes.action: Fund a 24-hour suicide text line
attributes.background: Many people suffer from severe anxiety and may not feel comfortable making phone calls to crisis teams or suicide helplines so they avoid calling which could put them in danger. Text lines could be quicker, easier and more comfortable for younger people as well as people with severe anxiety.
attributes.additional_details: ‘The share of device owners saying they make at least one voice call a week has dropped down from 96% to 75% over the past three years, according to research carried out by Ipsos Mori for Deloitte.’ Taken from The Guardian. This shows people are using phone calls less and less so making 24 hour text lines may make more people reach it for help when they need it. Texting is quicker but it can also help people feel more comfortable with opening up so they could be more honest to get the help needed.

attributes.action: Give local authorities a legal duty of care towards those waiting for housing
attributes.background: My son Lee had leukaemia, while in remission he was waiting to be housed by our council who failed to house him in time. Lee then passed away at my home from catching influenza when he should have been isolated from the public. I was suing my council but lost as we could not have our case heard.
attributes.additional_details: My solicitor and barrister thought I had a good chance of succeeding if all my evidence was heard first which then we could have proved a case of negligence.  However, the court decided that the council had no duty of care so they wouldn’t listen to all the evidence. Please sign this petition for future cases. If councils had a legal duty of care towards those on their housing waiting lists ALL of the evidence in this and similar cases would be heard and not decided before! Please see Ref: Court of Appeal court 75 applicants no B3/2015/1289 dated 11th April 2017 Lilian Darby versus London borough of Richmond upon Thames

attributes.action: Add tattoos to the protected characteristics under The Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop discrimination towards people with tattoos by signing this petition to add tattoos to the list of protected characteristics. This would mean employers cannot force employees to cover visible tattoos, as long as these aren't deemed offensive language or to any of the 9 existing characteristics.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 3 young adults in the UK have at least 1 tattoo today and this is still growing. Tattoos are part of different cultures throughout the world and are simply part of a person when they have them done. It is offensive and should be illegal for an employer to say to someone to cover their skin because they don’t like someone’s tattoo(s).

attributes.action: Get schools to teach life skills and how to handle emotions
attributes.background: Schools need to teach children more about how to handle their emotions. Talking to children about what to do with their feelings and how to express them without causing themselves harm. Also life skills, like managing money, building a career and learning how to start a life as an adult.
attributes.additional_details:
When leaving school, you have your grades, you have big plans about going to university and starting a life as an individual. But are schools teaching children what and where to go next? NO!
They don’t teach children what to do when they feel depressed, upset or handle their emotions. Self harm and suicide is on the rise! Schools can help this! 
They don’t teach children how to look into property and buying a house,  pay a bill and setting up direct debts. They NEED to teach life skills.
